I would give them another chance since my friend raves about this place.   I just know what not to order.

199.text: Wonderful, fresh, fast and flavorful. Helpings of the platter are single size. Good for lunch and dinner but not for leftovers. I love lemon and the tabbouleh was PERFECT! Shawarma is perfectly seasoned. Hummus a bit plain. UT very good and good consistency. Got an order to go to try dessert and grape leaves. Definitely would go back and I wish they catered :)

200.text: This place is tiny. It has basically 3 different types of ramen and you pick and choose your toppings. It is very unique for Vegas and it is what  typical ramen house is. I guess since I am not crazy for ramen, I just thought it was OHKAY. I had the miso ramen with kimchee and corn, because when it comes out it comes out bland. They give you 2 tiny pieces of pork, and it looks very fatty. The ramen noodles were good and seemed fresh. The soup is hearty. The noodles in the tonkatsu ramen are thin and look different.

201.text: This place was horrible and disgusting.  I love Mexican food but this place is the worst.  I ordered through drive thru and that great. When I got to the window to pay, I asked the cashier if the food was fresh and if the food they made was greasy? She said that the food was not greasy and the food was fresh. My order was sixty dollars and change, so yes we were expecting great food. It took a while and we understood the wait, that wasn't our complaint. Once we got the three bags that completed our order I noticed that something had opened, was heavy leaking or it might of been a mistake. We opened the bag and it was grease spilling out three burritos. It wasn't just like a teaspoon like but a lot. Exaggerated like and it was so disappointing to see that. So we opened the other two bags and the food looked so greasy with grease sitting in the to go plates. I got the cashiers attention as I was still by the window.  I asked her and showed her then her response was to get the cook.  The cook came up and said the meat is in water (its juice) and of course it's going to come on your food.  He said he can drain it but can't remake it. Told him that we wanted a refund and said that all sales were final. We argued a little then drove off, couldn't believe we just wasted $60. and change. Went to Roberto's and reordered and got a better product. What a shame!

202.text:
Probably the best happy hour!!
 We had 3 apps, shrimp tacos, spicy chicken bites and blue cheese chips. All were great !!  
Finished with the Cob salad, couldn't eat it all. Presentation was spot on flavor was awesome! 
 Def on the go back to list !

203.text:
I really want to like this location. I can't give it any more than 2 stars: 1 star for barista Fury and 1 star for decent bold drip. I have been to this location many, many times and almost always walk away unhappy. I order decaf americano for my mom, why does it always hit the bar as regular? I always have issues redeeming my reward at this location. .. unless Ms. Fury is at the register.
 I come to Starbucks with expectations. I don't think I expect too much, but the employees at this location make me feel bad. For wanting exactly what I ordered? For expecting to not pay for an add on to my FREE reward? 

Starbucks, I don't want to come to this location anymore. Please ask your employees to pay attention to customer orders and not ARGUE about an add on to a reward. Just correct it please. 

Enjoy, when the one nice barista is working.

204.text: I got 2 cupcakes here, one chocolate with buttercream icing and one raspberry with buttercream icing and raspberry jelly, First it was way too sweet in the icing to the point of making me feel I'll, the cupcake part was so sticky it stuck to the paper and when eating it, it seemed like I was eating play dough with how thick and stale it felt and the flavor was so mild you could not even claim it to be chocolate. The raspberry one was also way too sweet and the cake was the same. Between me and my 3 children with these 2 cupcakes,  more than half of both went into the garbage. That's saying something if kids don't even eat a cupcake. I had high hopes for this place but sadly I will never go back.

205.text:
Nothing amazing or WOW about this restaurant...  The food was lacking substance, flavor, and quality.  The prices were surprisingly high given that this is an off-strip, small restaurant. 
 Will not be returning.

206.text: Love Trader Joes!! This is a great location. The store has a great selection and has plenty of parking. The cookie butter is amazing. :)

207.text: I was so happy cafe rio was in summerlin. First day I go there with my son and the girls for my order all wrong. Kids quesadilla and a salad but ok first week opening I figured they are new but the one girl who finishes the orders before the cashier has the worst attitude ever!!!!!! I love the food so I come again a few weeks later. Same girl same stink attitude!! Cashier was rude too. So I love the food but I'll never come here again.

208.text:
First time having high tea. I loved everything about it.  The staff was super informative about the teas and respected your time without rush. We each ordered the afternoon tea which was $38 each person. It comes with the dessert, scones, and mini sandwiches. You also get your own tea pot with your choice of tea. Everything was so delicious and worth every penny. There is also an 18% gratuity.  Make sure to make reservations as it gets packed!! 
The only flaw was that our tea was not super hot and it got really warm fast. Other than that, I would def take my girls here!

209.text:
We stopped by on a Saturday for a group outing and things were just ok.  We got there at 5:45 and it was over 2 hrs before they could accommodate us for a race.  We ended up booking a bunch of races in advance just in case so we didn't have to wait again.  The nice thing about purchasing races is if you decide to leave early, just let them know and the races will stay on your account.

I had been to the old location and now the new locations and there are some pros and cons. Pro, new electric carts so no more exhaust smell.  Pro, games and mini bowling help to pass the time in-between races.  Con, the AC, seriously this place was so warm I was sweating the entire time.  I get it is a large place but it was easily over 85 degrees even after the sun went down. Con, $8 for a glass of wine that comes from a tap.  Con, took almost 45 min for what looked like a frozen pizza with no one else in the place ordering food.  Con, I know I am not the best or fastest racer but I had a grown man flip me off during the race because I was slower than he and his friend and he was unable to pass his friend with me on the right.  Grow up, dude.  Con, the price, between the 3 races, head sock rental, food/booze, the evening was well over $100+.

210.text:
Very disappointed in The Ostrich, just tried going with a group of people, however couldn't get in because some of the group, including myself we're wearing sandals... We were all dressed nicely and classy and we do live in AZ, I'd think they'd realize it's 100 degrees outside and this is normal attire for patrons. 

Talked with countless other people who were also turned away from the "new code" that started to get enforced yesterday, however nothing was published about this new dress code. Even the bouncer stated, wow "I'm making everyone mad tonight".

Not to mention we saw four very large guys WELL under dressed wearing flip flops walking out...but they were ok to be there because they got there before 9pm. 

These new rules are arbitrary and not consistent and very disappointing.

211.text: Wow! A waste if space! Most of atleast 20% of the games were out of order! Did you it did you not just open? It was way WAY over priced! They are sneaky about the way they do it too! Most games cost more then a dollar a piece! The place is set up horrible! Destiny is it will fail! Your no longer on the strip your in a local mall!  20 bucks 100 points a game takes 9 points 11 games 20 bucks! And we're talking a stupid ticket game that's over in 20 seconds! Same crap at chuck e cheese 20 cents....... No kidding!

212.text:
An annual update from my 5 star review from 1 year ago. 
We came back as we had a near perfect $400 dinner last year for our 45th wedding anniversary. Unfortunately this year was not a repeat.   Here is the blow by blow...
1. My wife discovered the bathroom had no soap... mind you this was at first opening. 
2. Service.  We were the first table seated, and was done so immediately at opening. Water and menus presented at seating.  After that the waiter disappeared for an extended time. Other guests had their orders taken quickly. In terms of service, our entrees came out about 20 minutes behind other guests... remember, we were literally the first ones seated. I finally had to ask about the status? Generically, the attention vs last year was night and day different.
3. Food: my wife had a Parmesan chicken dish., like last year. Presentation was AMAZING. It came with a lemon cream sauce, but the chicken was literally floating in it. She asked for a separate plate to drain off the excess.  The lemon was also a bit overpowering.  Last year I had the filet, but asked for a recommendation on the rib eye. He recommended a dry aged one. It was cooked nicely, but was a bit tough. Personally, I would stick with the filet. I also had the lobster tail, which was delicious, but at $85 was shockingly small. Independently, my wife observed how small it was...seemed at least 1/3 smaller than last year, and more expensive!!!
4. Lastly, my only issue last year, was the refill on a very small coke was another $5 like the first glass..... for 25 cents of soda, you are going to charge me ANOTHER $5? Restaurant responded here last year that they would address with management... I checked... still $5 for a refill.... on a $300 dinner...?? Waiter agreed it did not make sense. 
Unfortunately, we will likely be looking for another great Vegas spot to have our 47th anniversary.  Bookmark removed.

213.text:
Looking for a place to live out your sadistic food fetish? Zen Curry's got you. They have a spicy meter 1-10 listed on their board, but they said they can go up to 100. I got a 3 and I'm currently on my third bathroom break since dinner 30 minutes ago (from all the water I drank to try to cook my mouth).  The tiny Asian girl cashier says she eats a 12........ Is it creepy if I ask to watch her eat? How?! 
The shop is mainly a to go pick up joint, but they have plenty of tables to eat at. 
Where's the red ginger though?!

214.text: Have been there three times this past yearand each time was better than the last.   Very good quality for a chain.  Companion that I went with this time thought his steak was awesome.   He was leery at first    Cooked perfectly.    Staff  have  always been friendly and professional.  The shrimp appetizer and the macaroni and cheese side were delicious.  I recommend this place.                                         ***** update It's been a year since my last review of this place.   I must say this place is consistently good.  Myself and anyone else that joins me have always had a great meal.  The waitstaff has always been friendly.   This last visit the manager walked around and personally checked on everyone in the restaurant.   For a chain you can't beat it. Some people have had negative experiences.  However not I it's always been very good

215.text:
WORST SERVICE EVER.. 
This one's for you IRVING (waiter of the night)!

30-40 minutes to even get noticed (yes we timed him)??? Very unacceptable!!! No apologies, only a butt-hurt attitude to add the "cherry on top"..

What really set me off is...
It is FREEZING in the restaurant, all I asked for was miso soup.. Had to order it twice, almost a 50 min wait for MISO SOUP, and again... Even after the issue was brought up kindly-- no apologies ...

Even the guy refilling the waters was more attentive than IRVING..

How frustrating for something that could've easily been fixed ...

216.text: We had shockingly delicious food here! Went for the environment and activities, but will definitely return for the food. Went at 10pm on a Friday night, wasn't horribly packed so it wasn't too hard to find a table. They have foosball, shuffleboard, darts, billiards, just to name a few, to play (for free). There's also a bowling section that is ~$10-12/hr/person. We ordered the peanut fries (I know, weird sounding, right??), Lobster & bacon fries, cheeseburger, and fried chicken sandwich (this isn't the real menu name). Both the peanut and lobster & bacon fries were delicious. Combinations of ingredients you would never expect to be together, but absolutely delicious. Highly recommend. Both the burger and fried chicken sandwich were tasty, and a good size. What really solidified this meal-- the onion rings. O.M.G. The best onion rings I've ever had in my life. I don't know what they do to make them so amazing, but I could eat buckets of them!! We also had to coleslaw as a side-- also delicious. It's not a traditional cabbage and dressing coleslaw, but sooo much better. It was mostly brussel sprouts, and wow, was it tasty. They've done a really great job of taking basic bar food and making it really, really unique. I will come back here just for the onion rings!! Our service was excellent.

217.text: Great rueben sandwiches and pastrami! The reason for the one star knock off is because of the price. It was 10.95 for the sandwich and it doesn't come with a drink or side. It is in a casino, so the prices should be high. I used to go to stage deli, but I have to say, this place knocks stage out of the park! If I ever had a craving for pastrami or corned beef, I would definitely come back here.

218.text:
I love this cute little ramen house

I came here with my girlfriend right before they closed after a crazy night out.  There was only one other party inside.  Once seated, we were pleasantly surprised that they had late night happy hour.  However, the one ramen bowl on the HH menu was out.  We went for their shrimp balls on the HH menu to start.  For my ramen, I went with their Jinya Chicken with added corn and spinach noodles instead.  The Jinya Chicken consisted of chicken broth instead of pork base.  It also had bean sprouts, green onions, chili, spinach, and chicken.  I also asked for some black garlic oil on the side.  It was still a little bland so I added some of their gyoza sauce to give it more flavor.  I wish they had vinegar instead.  It was very good and super filling.  As for the shrimp balls, we had ask the waitress how big they were.  They were a LOT bigger than what she told us.  They were good though.  Extra crispy on the outside and filled with lots of delicious shrimp pieces inside.  It came served on a spicy mayo sauce.  We couldn't finish them.  

Our total was about $25.  I thought pricing was very cheap and reasonable.  The bowls all run about $11 each and any additional add-ons, such as corn, is another $1.  The service was excellent.  The girl waiting on us was very bubbly, sweet, and knowledgeable.  The food came out fast.  The inside of the restaurant is small but cute.  It has an urban vibe, which I like.  Overall, it's a solid ramen house that I would come back to.

219.text:
I'm happy to be Filipino and eating at this place made me thankful I am one. Ahahaha. To start off, great outstanding service the waiter name Justin knew his menu and explained in great detail. Always checked up on us and brings a good professional output in serving. 

Now for the food, was very surprise on the order of Calamari, came out in a big portion. We did order three different entrees as well KareKare, Pork Belly w/ Eggplant, and Garlic Fried Rice. Also for dessert, we ordered their popular dessert Bibingka Soufflé. 

Kare Kare: was very pricey but it had big chunks of oxtails in it good for three people. Flavor was good and loved the idea of the Sliced grilled vegetables on the side.

Pork Belly w/ Eggplant: Amazing! Felt like I never had this kind of Filipino dish before. Really juicy and tender with the mango and eggplant to balance the flavor. Great recommended choice ! 

Garlic Rice: instead of getting white rice I suggest getting the garlic rice for a couple dollars more. Good to feed about 3 people as well. 

Bibingka Soufflé: never had it, but I'm glad I tried this time. The texture is just like a creme brûlée. The hint of salted egg was surprisingly good. 

Great staff and great food do come by if you get the chance.

220.text:
After I smelled the aroma of spaghetti from a coworker's lunch last week, it's been on my mind and I have been CRAVING! I was looking for somewhere for pasta and my best friend recommended this place since it was close to where we wanted to stop by for dessert. I've only been to Oregnao's once, quite a bit ago, and I had a pasta bowl that was waaay to dry for my liking. I decided to give the company another try.

I ordered the bollo pasta.. if that was the correct name for it. It's just plain spaghetti. It came with angel hair and I didn't see any normal spaghetti pasta on the menu so I settled for it. My mistake because it really gives your pasta a different taste. It kinda mushed together in one bite and the texture was kind of off-putting. I ordered it with meat sauce and I literally got NO meat in my dish. Maybe like 4-6 pieces out of the ENTIRE portion that could feed 2-3 people. The sauce is completely chunky, meaning it was only really diced tomatoes (which is fine if you like that) but because of that, no sauce got on the rest of the angel hair, making the dish super dry. The tomatoes just stuck to chunks of angel hair. The dish was just CHUNKS of tomatoes and there was BARELY any sauce or meat! I felt pretty ripped off since I paid extra (granted it was like two bucks but I had to get more sauce because it was really just a chunky paste). Needless to say, my craving was never settled. 

That makes 2/2 for a meh experience at Oregano's and I'll hit somewhere else for pasta from now on since I've given them two tries. Server was nice though (Kristen I believe). No complaints about their customer service. She was working hard as she looked like the only waitress in the section. She was still attentive and friendly to everyone despite how busy it was. 

Also to add, the location was very small and kind of tight so you would entire from the front door, walk to the back OUT the restaurant to claim a table with a host, and go back inside the restaurant because it's pretty small.

221.text:
This place is awesome!!!

Big pieces of fish & little rice!!!!

My favorite sushi place in Vegas so far

222.text: Absolutely the worst sushi lunch I have ever had. The cucumber salad was old and wilted so I ordered a side salad and that was full of the bottom of a lettuce head to cut costs. Salmon skin handroll was disgusting and so hard I could not chew it.  The few rolls we ordered were terrible.

223.text: When we first went here about 5 years ago it was better, but we order the steak dinner and it's good but not great and you do get a lot of food for the money. The bad thing was the onion rings garnish they put on the steak...YUK it tasted like they used 10 year old oil. We both had to spit them out. The service is good and I would hope someone tells them about those onion strings. We really should have.

224.text:
I don't feel like I use the word "succulent" often enough in day-to-day conversation. I use it to describe Bandera. 

First off, I didn't even know it was a chain. And I say to that, whatever, it's a damn fine chain from what I can tell, so keep it up Bandera!

Last time I was here I had the salmon special and it was delicious, while my girlfriend nibbled on a salad that she was so-so about. The appetizers are good and the service was pleasant, and I will have to wait to try a dessert till next time. Which hopefully is soon.

225.text:
My family and I walked in around 1pm a few days after they opened and we were seated promptly. 

The restaurant is very large, unlike many other breakfast spots in town, so I was already pleasantly surprised. The decor is fun with spinning flowers dangling above the dining area and fun pictures to admire on the walls.

For my entree I decided on the fried chicken breast and waffles while my mom and fella both opted for different versions of the chilaquiles. As a last minute decision we ordered a pot o bread when we saw a bunch of them come out of the kitchen for another table, tempting us. 

Service was slow to start, but I cut them some slack since they just opened and are finding their groove. It got better and more attentive as the meal progressed. 

Our food came out and the portions were enormous, making me wish we had shared. My chicken breast eclipsed my waffle on my plate and I wish they had not places the chicken on top of the waffle since the heat seemed to make the waffle limp and a little mushy. The flavor of the waffle was good but the chicken wasn't as good as I expected. It was cooked well but the flavor of the batter seemed off. It had a spicy kick but still seemed very bland and had a starchy aftertaste that I didn't care for.

My mom and fella raved about their chilaquiles and after sampling them I can't say I agree. The temperature seemed a bit on the colder side and the cheese wasn't entirely melted. The steak that came with my fella's meal was a little over cooked and the seasoning was a bit overdone. He loved his dish, so I guess that's all that matters. The pot of bread was awful, I don't recommend this at all. It was dry and flavorless. I took a bite and left it alone. 

Overall, the service was good and the food was hit and miss. My family loved the meal so we will likely be back, but I will be sure to sample a different dish next time and hope for the best.

226.text:
One of the worse buffets I've ever eaten at.   I tried several of the meat items, and they were so tough that they were almost uneatable.  The crab legs were so overcooked as to be almost limp.  All of the remaining dishes I tried were so bland I can barely remember what they were supposed to be. 
On top of that, as I was paying my bill and leaving the waitress took my bill and then started screaming at me.   The only word I understood was TIP.  Apparently it was insufficient for her.
I will never eat here again.  Between the bad food and the rude staff, this place is just terrible.

227.text: If you're coming/walking from the city, the winery is on the far end of the Strip.  On a hot day, it's a terrible walk.  You walk inside to a dimly lit bar and there is a basement with barrels and chairs--where live music is played on weekends.  We were immediately greeted by someone and given a list, the tasting explained. You pay $10 for the first 6 wines on the list, $15 if you want the last reserve.  If you buy a bottle, the cost of the tasting is waived.  The attendant was good at explaining their wines, the process, the grapes, etc.  There were small portions of crackers and thinly sliced cheese between 1 oz servings.  I had the sangria, which was a nice balance of sweet and fruity, served chilled with ice.   It was a basic experience, and we had fun chatting and joking around with the man serving us.  More customers came in as we were finishing, so this place has a steady crowd it seems.  I think this is a place to explore later in the day, to see what the music scene is about.  The wine was good, their list simple--not a lot for a sweet wine drinker like myself.  All-in-all, it was a good experience, and I we learned some things.  It's a nice change from the grocers and cafes on the Strip.

228.text: I had a really terrible experience at this restaurant on my very first visit. It was Saturday Night and strangely they weren't as busy as i thought they might be. Just to list off the issues, the waitress was much more interested in talking with her coworkers at the bar than serving us. The food took an insanely long time, especially considering the fact they did not have a full house. Two out of four of our orders came incorrect even though the changes were simple, and there seemed to be little to no remorse or regret about this. The only reason they are not getting one star is because the food was okay AFTER being remade but there was still barely any mushrooms which is what took them over an hour to get onto my sandwich. But don't waste your time, there are too many good restaurants in that whole mall area to risk a bad experience here. I recommend Gordon Biersch. The rest of the review is lengthy so this first bit is the gist. The pictures I'm posting are a more detailed account of the terrible experience (yes, I'm that upset).

229.text:
DISGUSTING nasty ..
Food spills all over the place...
Slow service food with no taste just to have an idea the parm garlic bread sticks like olive garden was the only thing that I like along g with the peel shrimp...
Sorry but is was just as bad as the palace station $6.99 dinner buffet only 3X the $$$
Naaaa.
Passsss  next time 
Btw I did try more than 50 different items..

230.text: We made reservations on opentable for this place for my 6 yr. Anniversary dinner for the main reason that their menu shows that they focus on healthy eating and the foods change with the seasons. When we arrived we were greeted and sat down right away. The ambience this location has is so warm and comfortable, within minutes we had water at our table and a welcoming waitress asking what she can get us to drink. I stuck with water but my wife and our friend got a beer and I ordered the salt and pepper shrimp as our appetizer. (Yes, we had a friend come along to our anniversary dinner since afterward we were heading to a concert.) The waitress was so friendly and was quick to answer all the questions we had after bringing our drinks back. As we were getting ready to order the shrimp arrived and they were so delicious, They were perfectly seasoned and fried. I ordered the Cajun ribeye and it did not disappoint!!! I absolutely loved it. It was cooked to perfection and so juicy. For dessert we got the Ice cream on top of this cake thing... HAHAHA, don't know what it was called but I pretty much ate the whole thing. I gave my wife a bit and luckily our friend didn't want to try it which I was ok with because it meant more for me. The restaurant has warm and comfortable vibe to it, you can be dressed up or casual and it feels right either way. The cost wasn't that bad either for the amazing food we had!! Usually for healthy option restaurants you have to accept youll have to pay for what you get, in my opinion we got a smoking deal!!! To top it off the staff is amazing, they were so kind and welcoming... We will definitely be making a trip back soon, maybe once the menu changes so we can try something new!

231.text:
It's an entire enterprise centered on salads, customized and created right in front of you.  And that's enough alliteration for one review.

The value proposition is VERY simple.  If you want a salad, and you want to have a lot of control over what goes into it chosen from a variety of options, then go here.  If you want anything else in the world, don't go here (they have other menu items, but nothing that can't be beat elsewhere).

I will give a special mention of their beverage selection.  Pretty good unsweetened iced tea sits next to a fountain with multiple Boylan brand (whoops) sodas.  Better than your normal soft drink offerings.

(Oh, and because you have to basically go down the counter with someone as he or she makes your salad, I think it would be a hard place to go with groups, since there will be substantial lag in between the times the first and last people receive their salads--though it's not as big a problem as it would be at other restaurants, since you don't have to worry about your salad getting cold.)

232.text: The quality of the picture sucked. Honestly, it wasn't even close to as good as my tv at home. Plus, the movie theater tries to screw you over when you book tickets through the website - the entire booking / reserve seat process is literally backward. What appears to be the front of the theater is actually the back. Therefore, we were WAY too close to the screen when we thought we were going to be in the back. It wasn't a good experience, gave us a headache, and wasn't worth 2 bucks much less $18.50 per person. What a ripoff!!!!!! If it wasn't for the buckets of beer, this experience would have been worthless. I will never go here again. Complete waste of money.

233.text: Been to Hamburger Works a few times and they provide a fresh grilled burger. Nothing really amazing but decent food. The staff matches the food, no frills but fine. The restaurant has a cool interior but areas like the condiment area could be a lot cleaner. Overall, decent place for a quick burger but not a go to spot.

234.text:
I had a free night credit on my hotels.com account a few months ago, so I booked one night at the Venetian before our real stay at the Wynn.

I can't remember why, but my Yelp notes said the parking here was horrible... but it's complicated AF trying to find parking anywhere in Vegas, so I just get used to it. 

inside the hotel is obviously very nice and has a lot to offer with the Grand Canal Shoppes down below. The room itself was a great size and the bed was comfortable, but everything inside was SOO dusty and looked like it hadn't been deep cleaned in forever... if I was staying for more than 1 night I would've said something, but I just left it alone.

We didn't get a chance to check out the pool, but we'll be back!

235.text:
I would have given the food three stars but our waiter made my night.

One day I was really craving both korean fried chicken and ramen. On the same day, I found an article about this shop in Ohio City and decided to look at its menu. What did they have? Korean fried chicken AND ramen! This place serves old school korean fried chicken, the skin is not crispy whereas the modern KFC 2.0 has very thin and crispy skin.

We each ordered a noodle dish I got ramen and we shared a boneless KFC. When our noodles came out, we were so hungry and took care of that first before wondering where our appetizer was. The dish was very salty, I got the dipping ramen so it made a bit more sense that the dipping soup would have a stronger flavor. I'm not sure if it is supposed to be this way for dipping ramen, but I am very used to eating ramen very quickly while it is still hot. That is the way I have always learned and known to eat it, but this was certainly not your most authentic quick bite hot ramen shop. Nonetheless, it satisfied a craving and was quite good!

We finally got around to asking about the fried chicken and our waiter apologetically made an order, realizing he had forgotten to. We were not upset at all, but he still took it off the bill. We cleaned that entire dish so quickly and I was pretty happy. The food respectively though is a bit more on the more expensive end for ramen, but it is unique and special.

I really recommend the service, and intimate space at this restaurant! It is not the most authentic, but it is definitely a gem for Asian food in Cleveland!

236.text: My wife and I usually love to come here before a concert and have enjoyed their menu in the past.  Unfortunately, this last time was a bit of a miss.  After being told to sit anywhere we'd like, we went to take a table outside which hadn't been cleared of dirty silverware and water glasses.  That didn't bother us, but once we sat we were admonished to get up until someone has been able to clean it up.  So, we stood and waited for a several minutes, despite the fact that it was early and relatively slow, before deciding to just grab a table inside instead.  I ordered a beer - it was lukewarm.  My wife's tacos fell apart in her hands when she went to pick them up (perhaps sitting too long in their single layer corn tortilla).  We mentioned it to our waitress who simply responded "duly noted - I'll let someone know".  No attempt to rectify the situation was made.  While still eating, I needed to feed the meter outside and asked change a $5 bill for some quarters, only to be told "we don't make change for the meters"... OK, that's weird.  Fortunately, the bartending was willing to help me out from his tip jar.  We'll still come back, and hopefully our next experience and review will be better.

237.text: The best coffee in the valley, hands down.  Even their simple drip is phenomenal.  The staff, however, is always miserable.  A simple smile goes a long way, especially with the obligatory "do you want to tip" on the POS screen.  Gotta love the one girl that doesn't even ask what she can get you, but rather just stares at you until you proceed to order.  One day, I'll accept her challenge and stare in silence right back.  We'll be there for a while.  Or the other, that's so hip that she can only vocal fry "yeeeaaah" at you after telling her thank you.  Seriously though, cheer up!

238.text: Our waters were never below 3/4 full the meat was always hot every time it's nice not to be half way through a steak and it gets cold on you this place allows you to always eat a hot piece I love that! The waiters work as a TEAM that's amazing! We were asked multiple times by the people cutting the meat if we wanted a specific cut, and within 3 minutes he was back cutting it for us! 5 Star Service through and through! Sign up for their eClub our bill went from $74 to $43 TOTAL FOR TWO for lunch due to being able to use 2 coupons for the table according to the fine print! That's cheap for amazing flavor and prime cut steak and chicken not to mention the market table! The waiters deserve every ounce of a 25% tip VERY IMPRESSED

239.text: Food was a 4, service was a 3! Couldn't find the name of it online but we got the curry/coconut broth chicken soup for 2 with level 3 spiciness ("Adventurous") and it was incredibly satisfying. I'm not a huge mushroom fan so I picked them out but boy was that broth and tender chicken enough for me! I got the Larp (minced pork) with "Careful" level spice. It was good, but disappointing for me because  it was packed with cilantro, which I HATE and for some reason I always forget to ask for dishes without it. I wish I loved cilantro. It's in every good dish. Sigh. Anyway, my friends got the Stuffed Chicken and the Mango Curry and they loved their dishes even at the  "Native Laotian" top level spiciness! We went on a Tuesday night and they were understaffed so service was slow and they didn't seem to really care. Whateva! Honestly if I'm going to Willy for SE Asian food, I'm headed toward Ha Long Bay first thing!

240.text: Obsessed with this stuff!!! It's all delicious! My favorite item to get is a Gelati! I'm usually more of a chocolate type of dessert person, so I'll choose the double chocolate, red velvet or s'mores ice with the light vanilla custard. You would have no idea it's light. Well, I guess I don't know because I've never tried the regular custard since the light is amazing! Thick, creamy and sweet!!! Mmm sometimes I wish there were more of the toppings in the ice but that doesn't stop me from coming back! It's also fun that the flavors change so frequently. A surprise every time you walk in!

241.text:
Hello Las Vegas!  I'm Nette B. of Nette.Yelp.Com and I dined at your restaurant.  

I'll give the disclaimer now.  I've been to really good hot pot restaurants and unfortunately Chubby Cattle is just meh.  I've had hot pot in San Diego and Hawaii and my palette desires good tasting food.  
If you've never had hot pot then to you this is good. For me?  Meh... It's alright. 

We came here for my birthday dinner.  My choice while in Vegas so I can introduce my family members to Mongolian Hot Pot.  We made reservations for a table of 6 at 8pm on February 1, 2019. 
We arrived at 10 minutes to 8pm and our table was not ready so we waited a few minutes. We opt for the individual pots so that everyone in my party would have their own choice of broth.  

DISCLAIMER: Individual  small pot is not served in the ying yang pot.  Boo!  Other places I've been has the split pots for smaller individual. I will say that having tables with individual small pots is a great idea.  

Our server was Deni.  He was nice and he tried to recommend and upsell us on some platters etc.  I think they only one we fell for was the basket of vegetables in which we didn't eat it all and ordered extra baby bok choy instead.  We should've stuck with our gut and order 2 large bok choy.  He also tried recommending the oxtail broth and only 1 person in our party ordered that and she was not pleased.  She took the spicy hot broth from another person to add more flavor. 

I personally ordered the entry level hot.  Three people ordered the medium hot and they LOVE spicy 10 hot at thai restaurants and they were saying it was really hot & spicy where they were sweating.  LOL but still liked the broth.  I, on the other hand was thinking OMG this is extremely hot.  I scooped up a lot of red peppers in my pot.  See how red my pot in my photo.  But I pressed through and enjoyed my meal.  I had to ask to add more mild broth so calm the heat down.  Demi didn't come by to do that when I asked that I had to flag down another server who kindly filled my pot for me.  Also, we had to ask for our waters to be refilled.  :(  

Food: 
A lot of pork belly since I can eat 2 plate fulls for myself. :) 
Basket of vegetables
Rib Eye 
Mussels 
Tofu 
Squash from the conveyor belt
and noodles.  

So, the noodles are made in house.  If you are used to egg noodles then I would recommend the tomato noodles.  They have different flavors and they also offer a basket of noodles.  Blah, not happy with the noodles also.  I had to dip it in my soy sauce I created.  Speaking of created, there's a sauce bar where you walk up to in the middle of the restaurant when you enter and you make your sauce.  I used vinegar and soy sauce.  Others used the ponzu and garlic etc.  I was pleased with my sauce but the area looked a bit dirty and no one was cleaning it up to make it look presentable.  

At the end we spent about $200. Not bad prices but the broth prices are a bit pricey.  $6.99 for the oxtail broth.

I would return again If I desire Hot Pot in Vegas.  But my go-to would be in San Diego and Costa Mesa where the Hot Pot's are more desirable.  
Not bad but also not the best.  Lastly, I spoke to another friend who lives in Vegas who agreed with my feedback.  
  
#nette.yelp.com
#YelpBlackElite

242.text: Went today for happy hour and it was GREAT! Had a lager and a Hefeweizen and tried three different appetizers: the nachos with steak, pretzels, and artichoke dip. DELICIOUS!!! The service was great, the food was great and the beer was ice cold! Will definitely be back soon!

243.text:
What an experience!
Very expensive for what you will be eating here but your dining also comes with an experience  you will crave for, over and over again. 

We had live shrimp and couple of other things like lobster and hairy crab (were also live as the chef claimed, i did not see it moving). Very good and fresh. My favorite was the toro. Everything was great and I just wish we were given 2pcs of each instead of just 1pc, a lot of things that were served were new to us and having it to taste for the first time... one bite was not enough to remember it.

244.text: Food took forever to come out. By the time we got the food, we were disappointed with the food. The food was tasteless, hard, and pricey.

245.text:
No. Just no. Again, here I am with an unpopular opinion, but this place is overrated to the max. We came during restaurant week because I've been dying to make it out that way- and what better time?

I'll start by saying that the staff is incredible. The host, our server, everyone was warm and welcoming. 

The restaurant week menu consisted of a potato appetizer, a steak, and a chocolate dessert. There was also a "specialty" drink for restaurant week. 

To start, the rule was if one of us ordered the restaurant week menu, everyone at the table had to order it as well. Like, what? How is that even a thing- and if it is, why is that not mentioned in their restaurant week advertising? What if I just drove my vegetarian friend 35 mins, and now no one can order any restaurant week foods because there is only one option and it's meat?

The steak was chewy and gross - even my husband wouldn't finish mine. The potato appetizer ended up being the highlight. Such a disappointment.

Then, they are out of their specialty drink- okay, there is a replacement and it sounds decent. End of the story is that I paid $11 for a substitute drink that was basically water with a slice of pineapple.

Only cool part was the friendly staff and the fact that they display the record of the music that is playing at the time.

I was so angry that I got fancied up, drove all the way across Pittsburgh, only to be disappointed.

246.text:
I went here on Christmas Eve for lunch because I was always curious about it. Plus, the Chinese food choices in central Phoenix are pretty sparse. I would actually give this place more like 2-1/2 stars. I liked the tofu and pork clay pot we ordered. But the pork and kabocha squash dish was waaaay too salty. I feel like it was a spice, not MSG, that was the culprit. Either way, I had to scarf down a lot of water every time I ate some. We also had fried green beans with XO sauce, which is pretty simple to make. I know they have a buffet too and judging by what I saw during my stroll, the food seemed like nothing special. I did crack up at the using a tortilla container for the steamed rice. 

I could see myself going here if I was really craving Chinese food for dinner or lunch. But I'd get it to go rather than eat it there. The inside is the usual old-school Chinese restaurant decor with booths and tables. As someone from the Bay Area and who grew up in a Chinese household, I could definitely say I've had better. I know the owner is supposedly a chef with 30 years experience so who knows, maybe I went during an off day.

247.text: Come to a great homemade pie and coffee shop in Phoenix. They make the best Pot Roast, Green Chilli Pie, chicken Pot Pie, Tomato Jalapeño Pie,Green Chill Gringo.quicheBiscuits with eggs, meats, waffles,salads, coffees, and Thrifty Ice Cream.  They have shirts. Family owned.

248.text:
Came here for a farewell lunch for a retiring coworker.. and boy is this place pricy!  Thank goodness I didn't have to pay for her meal, dodge that bullet.

The quality was decent, but still miles from top notch.  The restaurant was pretty clean, and the staff was pretty attentive and annoying.  Service was super slow due to it being so busy, and the parking sucks.  

I wondered why my subordinate did everything to not come here even pretending that he has the stomach flu and that he was stuck in the loo doing a two.  He knows quality and value, I should of known if he doesn't like it, I probably wouldn't either.

Overall an average experience, I don't see a reason for me to return anytime soon.

249.text:
The house was beautiful.  We liked the rooms and alcoves.  It was definitely a place to go for a romantic setting.

The food wasn't as impressive as the setting.  Large liquor menu.  Very short dinner menu.

We started with the sherry bisque ... yes sherry not lobster or turtle ... it was a tomato soup with sherry with a topping of cream served in a coffee cup.  Our guest had the butternut squash soup served in a traditional soup bowl.  

We had the Ceasar and mixed greens salads.  The veggies were fresh and dressing were flavorful.

For dinner, we had the filet, elk, and shrimp & mussels with cannoli beans.  The waitress told us premium cut of elk and not gamey tasting.  It was GAMEY.  The filet was very good.  The shrimp, mussels & cannoli beans needed rice or couscous.

For dessert, sorbet and cookies ended the evening.

The waitress was very attentive.  The bathroom was on the second floor (up steep steps).  The valets were prompt.

We expected more from the meal.

250.text: Delicious I ordered the chicken kabobs, hummus and falafel balls all of which were well seasoned, fresh and authentic. You can tell the owners or the establishment take pride in the product they are serving and the freshness! Amazing food!

251.text:
I went to the Zoe's in Raleigh and it was fabulous! Pretty fast, just a lovely experience. 

However, my sister and I have gotten takeout on several occasions from this Zoe's and the service has been TERRIBLE. We've ordered in advance, told it will take 15 mins or so, show up and are told it will take a different amount of time. All in all, the last time we ordered takeout, my sister ended up waiting an hour total, at least 40 mins of which was spent in the restaurant. WHAT! I just dont understand that type of service for lunch takeout! What is the delay? The DNC isn't here yet, we called ahead, she took her time to drive there and she still spent MORE THAN HER LUNCH BREAK waiting on the food to be prepared! So disappointing.

This treatment is unacceptable. It is not my fault I was told one thing, showed up and then told another thing (wait longer). They could have told me from the beginning, "this will take 1 hour to prepare," and I would have shown up an hour later. COME ON!!!

NOT ONLY THIS! She called to speak to the manager and some girl lied to her saying she was the manager on the phone when she knows from being in the restaurant the manager is a guy (the same girl told her so). The fake girl manager hung up on her when she asked to speak to the real manager. (Um?) Terrible terrible service. Whatever happened to the customer is always right? 

When we finally got our food, it was cold. :-( SMH.

252.text:
Food: sushi on a conveyor belt and also option to order on iPad delivered directly to you on another conveyer belt. This is a similar set up to Kula Revolving Sushi Bar in Cupertino, CA but minus the super cute anime and reward system - no toys here :( 

The fish is fresh, however it lacks in options. Many have fried shrimp tempura or california roll (fake crab/mayonnaise) incorporated in them.

This concept is great to introduce someone to sushi or get them excited about it, like your kid, but otherwise the novelty is gone after one visit.

Service: friendly and efficient. You don't really need a waiter other than for drinks since you grab your own food.

Ambiance: casual and clean

Location: convenient parking. Located across the street from Ronald's Donuts (yum).

Don't plan to return, but might have to because my kid already wants to go back. Darn.

253.text:
The restaurant is inside the Gold Coast Hotel/Casino.
I've only been for lunch so far.
The food and prices are decent.
It's pretty good for reasonable chinese food.
They have the standard dim sum items for lunch.
The place gets pretty hectic for lunch, but it's the standard for any dim sum place that is busy. If you go for lunch and only have an hour, I suggest you definitely get there before 11:30am.

254.text:
Two stars cause the employees were nice and obviously working their asses off. 

The food was edible, but I'm not sure why I waited 50+ minutes for this. I wanted to warn the others on my way out.

So little onion on my six burgers. All of them. Five little diced pieces (crumbs) or so. Could not taste onion at all. One pickle on each, a small pickle with the center missing. Tasted a hint of pickle in a bite (I think). Meat tasted boiled. No flavor. Surely some shitty food. I wish I had gone anywhere else. 

Chicken rings were like smashed burger king chicken nuggets, except now the whole center is missing. Chicken inside? Not sure. Tasted dry, as if it were just breading.

The literal worst fast food I've ever had. I wouldn't ever come back. At least my curiosity is satisfied lol

255.text:
This is an amazing BBQ restaurant! The food is amazing, it's like being at a family BBQ. Friendly staff, and samples that are very tasty, big and good. Ths knly reason I gave kt 4 stars instead of five was because of the price point.  I wish it was a small margin cheaper because if it was I'd eat there more often. 
Even though, you're not disappointed when your stuffed! I would recommend to anyone the enjoys BBQ.

256.text:
I've been to Church Brew Works several times and will say it was very impressive on my first visit. However, each visit after I was less and less satisfied. First of all, it is a spectacle to see. The Church itself and stain glass decor is beautiful. The brewing equipment on display at the alter is in plain view and for anyone into brewing it is fun to look at. I mean, they turned a Church into a brewery!  If you are even remotely curious, I suggest you at least go for a drink and look around.

Speaking of drinks, that was my main draw as my love for craft beer put a big bullseye on this destination. The first visit I did a flight which had their standard 6 or 7 beers like Pious Monk and Thunder Hop along with a rotating tap or 2. I believe the flight had 8 decent size samples for $13 or so. Now that first visit was great and I took all of the beers in. After a few more visits I can say that only the Pious Monk and Thunder Hop are memorable.  The rotating tap is usually decent but the rest is not very good for my tastes. I enjoy IPAs and full body beers. These to me lack flavor and just come off as average domestics.  No complexity and watered down.  If I go back I will stick with what I know I like and see what the rotating tap is. You can get growlers to go for a very reasonable price which I've done before.

One nice summer day I was in and sat on the patio which is very nice and enclosed with flag decor. I ordered a Dark N' Stormy (dark rum and ginger beer over ice with lime) and I must say it is the best thing I have ever had at Church Brew Works!  And the best Dark N' Stormy I've had anywhere. I don't know what they do but they should keep doing it.

The food much like the seating is split into two distinct categories. Pub side and Dinner side. Pub is more traditional bar foods and is cheaper where Dinner is more upscale and a jump in price. I generally go for Pub side seating on the left (dinner to the right) along with that menu since it's usually a quick stop for drinks. I've had dinner as well but in my opinion it is all small portioned and very bland though the presentation looks very nice.  The last few times I've gone I have skipped food all together.  I should also mention that they have oven baked pizzas but again, small and bland. But they look nice.  I'm just not impressed by the food options verse price compared to other breweries I've been to.  

The service has always been top notch and friendly. The place is clean and huge so there is hardly ever a wait unless you have a big group. It is definitely somewhere you should check out for yourself and make a decision. Worthy of a trip just to say you've been there and see the spectacle but there are better brewery choices in the area.

257.text: Oh no- what happened to Jamms? Used to be my fave brunch spot but after today, No more! I ate the Pot of Bread which was very good; But, my eggs were so over cooked and the potatoes were not edible. Hard on the outside and mush on the inside. So I left paying $12 for a soft drink and pot of bread. The food has really gone downhill in my opinion. Never again for me. I'll cook my own eggs next time.

258.text:
BWW has it's ups and downs. The food is very hit or miss and the service is as well. That said, they do offer fundraisers for local schools and this is what led me to BWW recently. This was definitely an UP visit. The food was served hot, was tasty, and our server was polite and competent. I had the Chicken Buffalitos which were delish. My son had this sausage burger on a pretzel roll thing that he was stone silent while eating because he liked it so much. My littlest had the corn dogs from the appetizer menu which he loved. We had 1/2 price appetizers as well. Drinks were kept filled, tables bussed. Its the little things but they finally got it done right.

I hope that it's on an UP swing for a while now because I really do want to like it there.

259.text:
This is such a fun farmer's market! There's a wide variety of lovely local foods and crafts available here, as well as a plethora of food trucks to choose from. It's also an extremely dog friendly market. I saw so many cute happy doggos walking around with their humans, and there's even a booth or two that sells dog treats. 

Some of the vendors and products I remember seeing were La Belle Vie French bakery, local raw honey, hot sauce, AZ Fine Swine heritage breed pork, Double Check Ranch grass fed local beef, Blue Sky Farms produce, and a muesli stand. It's easy to browse through all the stands and even though there were a lot of people here when we went it didn't feel crowded. 

Parking can be hard to find right next to the market if you come a little later (We came here around 9 and it didn't look like there were many, if any spots left). We parked in a dirt lot a few streets away where other cars had parked but there's also a garage close by that you can use. 

I only wish this market were open a little bit later when the weather is cool. Their hours for winter are from 8-12 and they are only open on Saturdays. It's a bit of a trek for us to get to Gilbert and waking up early on our day off has to take some serious motivation! Also note that the later you come, the more likely products will be sold out.

260.text: Another gem located in the Cosmo serving mouth-watering Japanese cuisine! Everything from the tartare, corn, scallops, yakitori skewers, sushi rolls, miso cod, sea bass, and delicious cocktails; everything was absolutely delicious. The only fish I wasn't too fond of was the fried calamari. It's a little pricey but if you're in the mood to splash then this is a great place to do it!

261.text:
I intended to go to Streets on Carson but it was mysteriously closed. Urban Tap seemed a good alternative. The ambiance seems cool, it has good reviews, and it's a block away.  

We ordered wings (mustard BBQ sauce), shrimp tacos, and herb fries. The wings were cooked well but dry and relatively flavorless. The sauce was too thin and tasted like it was made hastily or, worse, came from a generic bottle. The tacos weren't good either. The shells seemed poorly made and had an odd aftertaste, my friend said. The fries were great. Nice balance of crunchiness, saltiness and flavor. I don't think I would go back. Most of the food was a miss, the cocktails were good and the service was great. But that's just not enough.

262.text:
Cheap and yes, they carry Tea, Snow & Coffee- just as they have advertised.

Was craving a Mung Bean Milk Tea, because 7 Leaves Cafe in Tustin, California makes a mean mung bean that leaves you wanting more.

Ordered a regular size ~ $2.75 for a milk tea with (honey) pearls. The drink came out in a larger size and rather quickly, oh gosh! Tbh, it wasn't as good as 7 Leaves because they add pandan to it and TS&C had a more grainy-bean texture to it from the blending of Mung Bean. Which at least is indicative that they use real mung bean in their drinks, just wish it was a tad bit sweeter and filtered a bit more finely. The pearls were cooked well, but not as sweetened as I had hoped.

4 stars for even carrying Mung Bean MT (seriously, try to find a place that does ... then PM me), great workers, fast service and cheap prices for boba. Their menu is also looking a bit extensive which means tons of variety! Plus, when you're done with the boba there's coffee and snow left to try too!

263.text:
Definitely a unique spot..

On recommendation I went with the Pig Burger combo.. the "crack" sauce and pickled onions made the burger for sure!

Fun, laid back atmosphere with probably one of the cleanest outdoor dining areas in the area..

I'll definitely be coming back for another lunch meal

264.text: The place was completely  empty at 11.45 on thursday.  The lunch menu  was reasonable.  The portion was fairly large. Food and vegetables  were very fresh . Even the chi Ken was moist.  Had the spicy basil chicken.  I could not taste the basil but did like the flavor. Service  was good . Place  is large . Parking is not a problem.  I also tried the curry red and  coconut  milk . This was very good

265.text:
This place was on my radar for a while now. A group of friends decided to go and try it out since all we have been hearing about was that the trash can nachos was something we absolutely needed to try. So we decided to go and before you know it we had a group of 10 people! (We roll deep!)Lol!

This place is located inside the Rio hotel and Casino, not far from the main entrance. It opens at 5pm and closes at 11pm so if you want to try it out, plan accordingly. The restaurant it self has a good vibe, and has a lot of cool decor on the walls and has a cantina style feel. I want to give you guys a heads up and tell you about the attire, this place has big window walls that over looks the pool area so don't be caught off guard if you see guest in there with shirts, and bathing suits. I'm not gonna lie, that one threw me off guard just a  bit since your use to the no shoes, no shirt, no service policy in many places but what the hey right, it is Vegas and it is the Rio!

Now, the good stuff, the food! The trash can nachos we came for, the reason for being at the Burro Borracho! The larger size Trash can nachos will cost you $32 you have a choice of meats which are on the Menu. It is suppose to feed up to 5 people....yeah well if your a Yelper it will feed two people! The trash can nachos were good, it was more of the fact that they were presented to you in a Large tin can which makes the experience cool, and different. To be honest you can probably go to a mom and pop shop and get the same quality for a whole lot less. 

The desserts that were ordered look like good portions, and those were something two people could share. I didn't actually taste them because I was too full for desert but they looked very pleasing, the churros looked good, as did the deep fried ice cream.

Over all a good, and fun experience at the Burro Boracho.

266.text: This place is wonderful. The food is fresh, it's served at the proper temperature and the portions are quite gorgeous. Tonight my wife and I shared an appetizer off muscles which was incredibly tasty and bountiful. We then shared a salad, which was served on two dishes by the kitchen. My wife had veal piccata with a side of pasta and I had the sauteed calamari with penne and a spicy red sauce. Each of the main dishes were wonderful. We skipped dessert as we were pleasantly full. Tonight we arrived at 5.45pm and were seated directly. By 6.30pm there was a slight wait, but that's not an issue as you can have a glass of wine or beer at their wine bar. We shall return and surely recommend to friends.

267.text: Definitely worth checking out! I had ordered to go and wasn't able to dine in but it was still a great choice. I ordered the wonton soup and the Hunan Beef Brisket noodle soup. The wonton soup was an amazing choice, well balance soup, flavors were present and pronounced with lots of surf wontons. The wonton itself had great flavor and overall the bowl was very satisfying. The noodle soup was also a great choice, noodles had great texture and broth had a nice kick, I highly recommend it. I would come back and check out more of their menu.

268.text:
I've been looking forward to trying this place ever since I saw the signage go up during a stop at nearby Coco Donuts. After my first visit, I have to say I am very impressed and I will definitely be back to try more!

(+) Enjoyed the tri-tip sandwich with a side can of diet coke. The sandwich was outstanding! The sauce packed plenty of flavor and the meat was tender and juicy! Nothing like a sloppy, saucy BBQ meat sandwich!
(+) I am not thrilled that there are no fountain drinks. They do serve their drinks from cans you grab from the cooler, BUT at least the cans are fairly priced t 99 cents! I can rattle off plenty of places that only serve cans, but gouge the *&^% out of you at $2 or $3 a can! Not here.


The sandwich does come with a choice of a side and I chose Mac and cheese (of course). The mac and cheese was alright, if not spectacular. It was the creamy variety, but in a relatively modest portion.

The dining/ sitting area is deceptively large and spacious. Plus there  are a handful of TV's with CNN, ESPN, etc playing for your entertainment. 

Prices are competitive. Not cheap, but not too bad either.

I enjoyed my first experience here and will definitely be back. I am anxious to try some of their cold sandwich selections as well. I would definitely recommend checking this place out.


4 solid stars.

I will be back.

269.text: Food was good and priced well as we all had the 3 for $10 special. Waitress nice and attentive. Our party was pretty bothered on how the male host handled our seating which kind of ruined everything. My father can't walk very well and has a hard time keeping his balance as he has a medical condition with his foot. When we go out we request booth seating near the entrance. This is always accommodated anywhere else we go but seemed to be a problem here. I went inside first and advised the host that we need a booth close by the door due to a medical condition for someone that couldn't walk very far. I noticed booths open directly behind the host area that would've been perfect. He seemed annoyed at my request and flat out told me "no that section is closed you'll have to sit over here at this table". Which if you've been in this chili's you know the tables are set up in a way where your chair is pretty much back to with the next tables chairs so not much room and he's a tall guy. This really didn't make much sense to me when there were still 2-3 parties seated in the supposed closed section and it was only 8pm on a Saturday night so it's not like it was nearing closing time. There were 3-4 booths available and it was literally 15-20 feet away at most from the next "section". Even if it was closed you couldn't have at least tried to make the accommodation given the circumstances? I wanted to make an issue of it but he's the type that doesn't want to start trouble so I had to bite my tongue while he sat at a cramped table to eat uncomfortably the whole meal.

270.text:
Why did I think that their Steak Nachos would be any better than their Chicken Nachos?

This goes for all places that serve nachos, use real nacho cheese or at least cheese that doesn't dry up to where it becomes a clump of crap.  And if you do use cheese that dries up after being melted at least distribute it evenly all all the chips so that there isn't a lonely dry chip on the plate. 

I was impressed with the size of the Steak Nachos.  I was excited to dig into it.  When I grabbed one chip, it was stuck on to multiple chips that had cheese "melted" on.  Right then I knew this meal was going to go down hill.  

The Nacho Cheese was cold and so was the Steak.  I think the Steak should have been hot, right?  I mean, how do you screw up Nachos?  It tasted like our food was sitting on the counter for a while before it even got to us.  

I asked the waiter for a side of the Nacho Cheese because there were so many chips that didn't get cheese.  It wasn't until she brought us a side of cheese that made this bearable to even enjoy.  The Nacho Cheese was HOT!  The way it should have been when it came out. 

So with that being said.... Happy Eatings!  Until next year....

271.text:
Did I miss something or what? My son brought me here for a late lunch after a Dbacks game. Passed on Chinese which I regret now. We purchased 2 doubles, a single, 3 FF's animal style and 2 large drinks to go. Total...$23 and change! I got the single thinking it would be enough for me. My mouth was watering thinking about a nice thick juicy burger. Wrong! The only thing juicy was the lettuce and tomatoes. I opened the burger to discover a 3 1/2 inch diameter, thin wafer of meat, dry as a bone. Some parts I could actually see through. It was thinner than McD's. 1/8th pounder? I couldn't even taste it. I think you need to order the triple to taste the meat. By the time we got home (5 min.) the cheese on the FF's congealed into one big glob. I ate it cause I was still hungry after the burger. I ate it like a potato pancake. It was unappealing but tasted OK. My son liked his meal? 
I would go to BK's, McD's or Pete's any day of the week at 1/3 the price. Sorry son!

272.text: We came here with a group of 7 friends. Service was good considering the place was packed. Several of our group opted for the all you can eat. A couple ordered off the Hibachi menu. The Rolls and Sushi came out fast, the cooked items a bit slower. Good rolls/sushi, fairly typical of all you can eat places. Cooked items we good as well.

273.text: Fun place !! Funky and steam punk style. I do agree with other reviews, that they need more harry potter themed decor besides a bunch of old suitcases and sticker decals. I had the pistachio iced latte it was amazing and very strong . We had yummy cookie butter waffles, (they took forever to make our food), small portions of food but actually it was just enough in the end. Iam giving this place 3 stars because, my waffles were served with ice cream; one big scoop just sitting there on my PLATE OF FOOD melting away all over my waffles. They did not offer me a spoon, so im sitting there, eating ice cream on a plate with a fork! At there prices we shouldn't have to beg for silverware. The employees are snooty. This place is a good idea in theory i just don't think its there yet. Im gonna keep trying tho, i will be back.

274.text:
I really really wanted to love this place. But honestly it's just pretty meh to me. Where could you go wrong with gourmet grilled cheese, tomato soup and beer? Well let me tell you.

So I decided to skip an app and get the Full Monte Cristo. This wonderful sandwich contains Swiss and American cheeses, roasted turkey, tavern ham, toasted bread (pretty sure it was texas toast), with a side of berry preserves. Oh my lord was the sandwich good. The berry preserves just set it all off. But it went downhill from there. I opted for onion rings which were under cooked but whatever. The worst part of this whole meal was the smoked tomato soup. I like my tomato soup to be tomatoy and it wasn't. Just tasted like smoked flavoring. Blah, no thank you.

The service was absolutely terrible though for the place only being somewhat busy. Took forever to get my food and refills and when I did see the waitress, she was very moody. No thank you.

275.text: I gave this place 5 stars because the first two times my wife and I came here we had the same waiter who was great, very attentive, checked on us often, and was just a cool dude. The service def made up for the average food, it's really nothing special. Brought friends here that were visiting on multiple occasions since then, and it's just been worse and worse. Our waiters during those visits were literally non existent, it got to the point where anytime a runner or random waiter would bring us something, we'd just start placing random orders for things knowing it would take forever to be relayed to our actual waiter and then brought over. Yeah, the patio area is nice overlooking the park, and it's def a Sunday funday spot, but it's gotten to the point where dealing with bad service on top of average food just isn't worth it.

276.text: We like this grocery store a lot. The meat is always fresh and hormone free. Their produce always looks and tastes great. The cashiers and baggers are always nice and I've never had a rude employee help me out. I just wish it was closer to where I live.

277.text:
I'm not one to harsh on an employee who's just doing their best, but this Dunkin' Donuts gets one star for several reasons. One star from me is rare since I'm usually pretty easy going an forgiving, however here are the reasons for the single star.

Reason 1: Upon checking in on the Yelp app on my Android phone there was an offer for a cup of coffee for $0.99. The store lead, Steven, looked at the Yelp offer and said he could only provide that price if there was a barcode for the offer. Since there wasn't he said he couldn't do anything for me. Really? Aren't you in charge of the store? How come Uncle Dunkin' didn't give you full authorization? Dunkin' Donuts needs to get their act together regarding their partnership with Yelp and check-in offers.
Reason 2: The donut selection at this location was pretty sad. There were just barely 20 different donuts to choose from and each donut cost $1.09. If you head to a regular mom/pop donut shop, the selection is always larger and the cost per donut is also cheaper, typically around $0.60-0.70.
Reason 3: I ordered a chocolate and rainbow sprinkles donut because I like chocolate and the rainbow sprinkles are because I'm in touch with the kid in me. Anyhow, as you can see from my photo, Dunkin' was pretty stingy with the chocolate glazing. Less chocolate means less adhesion for sprinkles which means less sprinkles which then means more savings to Dunkin's bottomline on sprinkle costs. All this yields unhappy Ben.
Reason 4: My buddy ordered a breakfast sandwich and after waiting 13 mins we asked the counter what the status of his sandwich was. Their response was that they simply forgot. The shop only had 3 other people inside (besides our party of 4) all of whom were already finished eating or eating their orders therefore the employees being super busy isn't particularly valid.

C'mon Dunkin' Donuts, step up your game or you'll go down in shame! 

(I'm kind of proud of this rhyme)

278.text: There is nothing worse when you dine at a restaurant and they mess up your order. She completely missed my sons simple order of a chicken ramen noodle soup with only the broth, noodles, and slices of meat. Once it was time to pay the check. She refused to take our one hundred dollar bill. Mind you we were the first customer there at the time of open at 11:30am. Fortunately they miraculously had change for us after all. Very disappointed with my visit here and do not know if I will want to come back.

279.text:
Loved the atmosphere of faux Paris. The "city streets" surrounding the tables were lovely. We went for breakfast and stuck around for lunch. I'm not such a breakfast person, so I enjoyed the lunch table considerably more than breakfast. 

Some of the foods such as the creamed spinach and the hollandaise on the eggs benedict lacked seasoning and left something to be desired. This buffet didn't blow me away, but that's because I kept comparing to the Bellagio Buffet I had visited the previous day.

Breakfast faves of my table:
Bagels and lox with all of the fixin's
Prime Rib Hash (the BEST...I keep thinking about this dish!)
Braised Cherries

Lunch faves:
Grilled lamb chops with chermoula sauce
Grilled asparagus
Spicy mussels with rice pilaf
Roasted tomato bisque

280.text:
I love supporting a local business! And this one does not disappoint! This young ASU graduate, is seriously serving up some quality food! With a simple menu, quality ingredients, and an array of toppings for tacos, enchiladas and soup! 

I have driven by Gadzooks a million times, and finally stoped in!  I haven't heard much about it, so I'm hoping to get the word out! It's so DELICIOUS! 

It goes like this... if you're having these amazing enchiladas or tacos, you choose the protein, corn or flour tortillas, next, the amazing enchiladas sauce, red, green or both! (Like I did!)
The enchiladas are served up in a stone dish, then places in a hot open fire!  Once out, you choose your toppings, from the assembly line of goodies! 
Extras, are served a'la cart, so you'll spend extra on guacamole, chips and salsa, and sides. But the value is there! I promise you won't go away hungry! 

These guys are accommodating, so if your feeling low carb, then do without the tortilla's and make a bowl, lots of greens to choose from! (But, really, splurge, it's worth the extra exercise time!) 

So happy I finally stopped at Gadzooks!

281.text: Terrible service, went to have wood fired pizza and claimed they were out of stock, truly absurd.  Go to Grimaldi's they never run out of their beyond amazing pizzas!  This place will go bankrupt.

282.text: I am so glad to have found a good Chinese restaurant.  I have tried so many below-average places that I thought Phoenix just didn't have good Chinese!  I settled on Beef with Broccoli and I was very happy.  Plenty of meat and broccoli, and the sauce was very tasty as well.  It was not the average beef with broccoli sauce.  The meat was of good quality too.  My dinner date who is Chinese commented that the brown rice was good and properly cooked.  The server's English was not good and when she couldn't tell me what precisely was in a certain entree, I settled on the something I knew wouldn't be a surprise.  It seems that after reading some of the negative reviews that a clear and detailed menu would solve a lot of their customer service issues.  I am definitely coming back!

283.text: The portions are terribly light on the protein and veggies.... But heavy on the starch (rice and noodles). Additionally, I wasn't thrilled with the pad Thai or the soup either. The green curry taste the same as the red curry... Maybe a little more red pepper in the red curry. The customer service was slow and rude even though there were only four other patrons in the restaurant. I would pass on this restaurant next time.

284.text:
Being a Thai food junkie and a Los Angeles transplant, finding an awesome and might I add relatively authentic Thai joint has been a tad bit difficult here in the Valley of the Sun... Thankfully with a little digging I ran past some awesome articles about this joint so it was placed on the top of my list of must try restaurants! 
It's a bit of a trek for me, but it was well worth it. The service was amazing, they were friendly and helpful without being over bearing! We ordered a bit of everything, and it was all amazing. Prices were super cheap for the quality and amount of food you get, I had days of leftovers and left full! They even gave us free desert (green tea ice cream!!!!!!)

I will be back!

285.text:
This place is conveniently located next to one of my favorite (one of the best in Phoenix, I think) pho restaurants, Pho Thanh! 

It's a cool little Shop. 
The inside is small but the space is very open, nice place to lounge and enjoy your drink! 

I always get the same drink... Taro milk tea with honey boba. It's great for any boba craving you may have. Their menu is limited, but the options they have should satisfy everyone. It's not too sweet and the taro milk tea has a good taro taste and texture, not watery or thin. 

Overall I think it's a great boba shop! Their glass bottles are good for an instagram photo-op and the drinks are cheap and tasty. It's always on my radar when I'm in the area!

286.text: Been coming here for years. I love the chicken with black bean sauce so of course I don't see it in the menu anymore. Other than that I love this place.

287.text:
This location is a mess... I avoid dining in as much as possible. But this is literally 5 minutes away from my house and if I'm hungry for some nachos... I will come here... I'll just order out though. Haha!

The cleanliness of this place is not up to par. The staff is usually miserable and grumpy. They're ALWAYS in a rush... So I take my time ordering. I hate feeling rushed! The staff obviously has issues with each other. The cashier was telling one of the dish washers to cut some veggies up. Dishwasher responded "it's not in my job description". The cashier was visibly irritated. I mean, c'mon... The very slightest ounce of professionalism goes such a long way. They need to get it together.

288.text:
Needed a place to grab a bite to eat and get some work done. Was very surprised to find out they don't offer WiFi.  I ordered a sandwich & soup combo. For the price you pay, the taste was mediocre at best.  They need to understand what a salad is and not lettuce shoved into a cup. Also when you use lettuce for a sandwich, don't use the hard core parts. 

The bakery looked appealing, but the comments from the people behind me said it looked much better than it tasted so I opted not to get any. 

The environment is cute and they have home decor for sale, but I can get the same items at Hobby Lobby for half the price. 

This will not be a place I will jump on going back to anytime soon.

289.text: Seriously whoever didn't give this five stars must be an idiot. This is the coolest, most impressive fountain show you can see. As a local, I will literally drive down and watch the shows any chance I get. The song choice is dramatic. The entire feeling you get is grand and impressive and you will be artistically moved. It's a must see.

290.text:
I keep craving their food since my first experience here a couple of weeks ago.

Our waitress couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. She brought us chips and we helped ourselves to the salsa bar, which is pretty cool. They serve authentic, delicious Mexican food. I had carne assada with rice and beans, and my husband had enchilada. Everything was very well prepared and tasted great.

291.text:
I will not go back to this Mad Mex. I would have had a more pleasurable experience at Taco Bell. It's Cinco de Mayo and I wanted to have Mexican food to celebrate. Coming here was a big mistake. 
First of all they were carding at the doorway which is fine but it made no sense at 4pm. Then I ordered a drink, and the waitress came back to ask me how old I was. I already had a wrist band on and I was again asked how old I was? Made no sense to me AT ALL. I told her I was 21 and she then told me I wasn't even allowed to be drinking because my girlfriend isn't 21. So I had to be 25 and the bouncer at the door screwed it up so why am I punished? She also mentioned that the manager wanted to take my drink away, which was not happening. 

Our food was average, but its Tex Mex so I can't expect much. I got the bill and was charged for guac when I specifically told the waitress I just wanted sour cream and no guac. Our waitress was also rude at times for no reason. 

I know it was a holiday so it was busy but this is inexcusable for a restaurant. Not happy at all with this place.

292.text:
I went here for a birthday celebration, and I was pretty underwhelmed by the whole experience. The service was extremely slow despite having a reservation. There were several large parties at the restaurant and they seemed to be sucking the wait and cook staff away from attending to us. It took at least 10 minutes for someone to take a drink order, although the support staff filled our water very regularly and were easily the most attentive staff there.

Beyond the service, the Spanish tapas were disappointingly mediocre. Having lived in Spain previously, I was really hoping to find a high quality tapas restaurant in Charlotte and thought the food was very average and definitely overpriced. The pimientos rellenos were the only truly outstanding dish out of the twelve we tried. The classic tapas like croquetas and patatas bravas were fine but nothing great. DO NOT order the espinaca catalana - very disappointing.
